hypothesis: Cooldown window (max -15.0, linear decay over 3 sessions) will drop recently-visited domains below #2, forcing rotation. Combined with abbreviation map fix, visit Gini should decrease.
method: Two interventions in dispatch_optimizer.py: (1) Graduated cooldown penalty for domains visited in last 3 sessions (gap=1: -15.0, gap=2: -10.0, gap=3: -5.0). (2) Abbreviation map expanded from 18 to 59 entries.
expect: Meta drops from #1 position. Simulated Gini on S358-S368 data should decrease from 0.827 to <0.60.

visit_gini_snapshot.note: Gini INCREASED in snapshot because accurate data reveals true concentration — this is correct. Cooldown mechanism prevents FUTURE concentration.

diff: Predicted meta would drop from #1. CONFIRMED: #1→#3 (-16.5 points). Abbreviation map bug was NOT predicted — discovered during implementation. This is a second root cause of the score-behavior gap: the saturation penalty was computed on 27% of meta's actual visits, making it 3x too weak. Two root causes of Gini 0.827: (1) no hard rotation mechanism (fixed by cooldown), (2) outcome data 65% incomplete (fixed by map expansion).
